item.title: CSV Special Character
item.description: Separate CSV data with a special character (example: thorn þ). Google DFP (Double-click for Publishers) uses a special character in their CSV exports. Specifically the thorn character and it’s a pain. But Ruby can make it better. You can skip to the bottom of this article for the neccessary code or read on from here for more details about figuring out the path to certainty. Unicode Find the unicode character. For my example the thorn character þ is represented as u00FE.
